statements.name: PROC MAPIMPORT
statements.description: Identifies the input Esri shapefile and converts this map into a SAS/GRAPH map data set.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output map data set that is created.

arguments.name: DATAFILE=
arguments.description: specifies the path and filename of the shapefile that is read and processed.

arguments.name: CONTENTS
arguments.description: displays information about the shapefile, including field identifier names and types.

arguments.name: CREATE_ID_
arguments.description: creates a map ID variable named _ID_ with a unique value for each polygon in the map.

statements.name: EXCLUDE
statements.description: Specifies one or more fields from the shapefile that are excluded from the output map data set.

arguments.name: 'field-identifier
arguments.description: specifies one or more fields from the shapefile that are excluded from the output map data set. All of the fields that you do not specify are included in the output map data set.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Reorders the map polygons by one or more identifier fields.

arguments.name: 'field-identifier
arguments.description: specifies one or more fields in the shape file that identify the polygons in the map. The values of the fields that you specify are used to reorder the map polygons and assign segment numbers in the output map data set.

statements.name: RENAME
statements.description: Renames variables in the output map data set that correspond to specific fields in the shapefile.

arguments.name: 'field-identifier'=
arguments.description: assigns a variable name in the output map data set for a field in the shapefile. You can specify multiple field identifier and variable name pairs, separated by a space.

statements.name: SELECT
statements.description: Selects the fields from the shapefile that are included in the output map data set.

arguments.name: 'field-identifier
arguments.description: specifies one or more fields from the shapefile that are included in the output map data set. If you do not use the SELECT statement or the EXCLUDE statement, then all of the fields from the shapefile are included in the output map data set.
